SEARCH
Package com.GraphicalPasswordAuth.controller

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
com.GraphicalPasswordAuth.controller.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") @CrossOrigin(origins="*") public class UserController extends Object
REST controller for handling user-related operations such as signup, login, password reset, and retrieving encrypted icon sets for graphical password authentication.

  • Method Details

    • signup

      @PostMapping("/signup") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> signup(@RequestBody User user)
      Registers a new user with an icon-based password.
      Parameters:
      user - The user details submitted in the request body.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the registered user or an error message.

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> login(@RequestParam String email, @RequestParam String iconPassword)
      Authenticates a user using their email and icon-based password.
      Parameters:
      email - The user's email address.
      iconPassword - The user's graphical password.
      Returns:
      A success message or a 401 Unauthorized response.

    • requestReset

      @PostMapping("/request-form") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> requestReset(@RequestBody Map<String,String> payload)
      Initiates the password reset process by generating a reset token.
      Parameters:
      payload - A JSON payload containing the user's email address.
      Returns:
      A generic response indicating a reset email has been sent (if applicable).

    • resetPassword

      @PostMapping("/reset-form") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> resetPassword(@RequestBody Map<String,String> payload) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Resets the user's password using a secure token and a new icon-based password.
      Parameters:
      payload - A JSON payload with the reset token and new graphical password.
      Returns:
      A success or failure response depending on the validity of the token.
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - If the encryption algorithm is unsupported.

    • getEncryptedIcons

      @GetMapping("/encrypted-icons") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getEncryptedIcons(@RequestParam String email)
      Retrieves the encrypted icon set for a given user's email. Used to render the graphical login grid.
      Parameters:
      email - The user's email address.
      Returns:
      The encrypted icon set or a 404 error if not found.
